intro: Micrechites borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean dwarf fern, is a rare and endemic species native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that typically grow close to the forest floor. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical vegetation. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are clustered on the underside of its leaves, a common feature in ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Micrechites borneensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
